title: Thunderbird 115.9.0 (64-bit) HTML Signature
content:
Hi Everyone,

I am trying to add a HTML signature to my emails and added it to the HTML box in account settings. I then go to my emails to check that the signature looks ok, so open an email and and my signature flashes up then disappears. I sent the email just to make sure and there is no signature. Does anyone one have any ideas why this might be happening. It worked fine at the start, but then this keeps happening.
creator: rainer3369

title: Drag and drop emails on local drive folder
content: Hello, It's there any option/setting in mozilla thunderbird for drag and drop emails to local drive folder and save them under another filename that the standard "Subject" name? I don't know if i'm clearly enough, that's why i want to make a briefly description of the operation i want and the way the emails i want to appear in my folder. I drag and drop an email to my folder and this email has the filename represented by the "Subject" of that email. Can i change the way emails are saved ? Or can i drag and drop emails from one sender in separate folder ?

title: Feature request: Pin "Favourite Folders" to the top of the folder list
content:
Pin "Favourite Folders" to the top of the folder list so when scrolling that pane for other folders, favourites will always be visible.

I don't know if there's any more I can say about it, just would be nice to be able to have "Favourite Folders" always visible when scrolling through the folder pane.
creator: ml17

title: Setting reply to account as different from my registered acount
content:
Short background: My account is an aol and my address is xx@aol.com. When I send an email it arrives at the recipients inbox as "from xx@aol.com" - when they reply it is to "xx@aol.com"

I have an email which is x@y.co.uk - this is good because it is in the format "<myname>@<mysurname>.co.uk" which is easy to remember. Any email to this address goes to my aol - so far so good.

My Problem: When I send an email on Thunderbird - it arrives as xx@aol.com; and someone replies it shows as xx@aol.com. What I would like to do is show it arriving as "<myname>@<mysurname>.co.uk" and with a reply-to as "<myname>@<mysurname>.co.uk". Please is this possible, if so what can I do. Finally, more important is the reply to address. If I give someone my "<myname>@<mysurname>.co.uk" email address, I would like at least for them to be able to reply to that address.

Thank you all for any assistance you can give,

Jay
creator: jay125

title: nezobrazuje se tělo mejlu -  u některých emailů ano, u některých ne
content: Dobrý den, u některých emailů se mi nezobrazuje obsah emailu a u některých ano. Pokud se nezobrazuje, pak ani když dám email přeposlat. Toto se mi děje již několi dní, takže můžeme vyloučit základní akce, které většinou pomáhají - restartovat ) Co způsobuje nezobrazování emailů se mi nepodařilo vypátrat. Nevíte, jak bych mohla chybu fixnout? Děkuji Marie
creator: marie.struncova
